name: Hidden Ridge Resort

reviews.text: We were a group of 7 travelling to Banff from Toronto for some snowboarding the first week of January 2010. Rented 2 vehicles from Budget at the Calgary airport, drove to Calgary and with the help of the GPS on my iphone, was able to locate a T&T supermarket just 15 minutes from the airport. Did all our grocery shopping for the week there. I must say I am quite surprised at how much more things cost in Calgary! Went to a Vietnamese restaurant call Kim's (?) 10 minutes from there (again with the help of my iphone!) and had some lunch. The food was so-so, but the beef and the spring rolls were delicious!
reviews.title: Best vacation yet!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From there it was driving straight on the same road that turns into HWY 1 which takes us straight to Banff. The drive was beautiful. We had sun every single day of our 6 day trip, although it was cold at times. Approaching the mountains was breathtaking!
reviews.title: Planning my return before I checked out!

reviews.text: Paid approximately $130 at the toll booth when entering Banff National Park. This amount was for 1 car only, the other couple had to pay roughly the same amount as well.
reviews.title: Spacious Unit!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hidden Ridge Resort is 2 streets north of the main strip, very easy to find. I can't say enough about the accomodations here. Everything was new, and clean, just small. We stayed in the 2 bedroom plus loft. Kitchen is really small, we had to be very creative when putting the groceries in the fridge. One person can fit comfortably in the kitchen, any more than that and it is really cramped! We were able to park our vehicles right in front of our unit. Service was excellent, they come to change your sheets and towels everyday, and deliver firewood right to your fireplace! Outdoor hottub fabulous, one pool was very hot; I couldn't stay in there too long (although everyone else was able to), the warm pool was just fine for me. There are only 2 washers and 2 dryers in the laundry room.
reviews.title: Hidden Ridge, Hidden Pitfalls

reviews.text: Cook and ate at our condo every day except for one evening we went to the Grizzly House. Was expensive and food not very good at all. Kind of weird atmosphere, wouldn't recommend eating there.
reviews.title: We loved it, just what we were looking for!”

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had such a wonderful experience at Hidden Ridge Resort. We went for our 10th anniversary. We loved the hot tub area and couldn't wait to go every night and visit with others about the cool things they saw and did that day. The staff was excellent, amenities great. Free bus passes and cheap phone calls were a bonus. We can't wait to return with our kids and friends. We missed it after we left!
reviews.title: We'll be back

reviews.text: This is the third hotel owned by this company (Banff Lodging – I think) that we have stayed at. Hidden Ridge is above the town of Banff off the main strip. It is a very nice location with nice views of the mountains and a quite setting. Bus service from the hotel to town and the ski resorts was very convenient and while it is a good hike to town I wouldn’t make a short hike to town in the winter. It’s not more than a few minutes’ drive so into town so no big deal.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Banff

reviews.text: We chose this hotel because the rooms are a little larger than the regular hotels on the main drive and they all have a full kitchen. The rooms were nicely arranged and the kitchens had everything we needed.
reviews.title: Beautiful, definately Banff’s Hidden Gem

reviews.text: The kids had a great time in the heated pool and hot tub. Both are located outside overlooking the town and had a very nice feel. While they can get crowded at night with some of the younger adult guests everyone was very friendly.
reviews.title: Skiing dream

reviews.text: The staff I encountered were all very friendly and helpful. We go to Banff every Christmas break since moving to Canada and I suspect this hotel will be the one we stay at from now on. As a side note we have stayed at the Fox also and it was very nice but with 3 kids we needed the extra space that you get at Hidden Ridge.
reviews.title: We'll definitely go back
Good place, great hot tub!
reviews.text: We liked it, exactly what we expected... basic condo but well equipped (although we didn't cook any meals, I would say basic kitchenette). Clean, room, great hot tubs and the real reason we stayed here..

I have stayed at this resort for the last 2 years and I have never ever been dissapointed. I usually get a three bedroom walkout condo, with fireplace, two bathrooms and they even give my little pomeranian a doggy bed and some dog bones! Staff is very attentive, firewood is delivered right to your door, even extra ammenites and a late checkout can be easily arranged.
reviews.title: Melt in the gorgeous outdoor hotpools!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The other property they own is the Fox Hotel and Suites.....and that is also a very nice resort. I prefer the Hidden Ridge as I travel with my two older kids and my dog. I love the wood fireplace and granite kitchen. Make sure to ask for a newly build condo to get the best of the place!
reviews.title: Absolutely the best vacation!!!

reviews.text: P.S. There are honeymoon condos with private hot tubs for extra luxury!
reviews.title: We'll be back again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hidden Ridge from Jan. 26 through 31 in the Premier King suite. From the moment we arrived to the time we checked out, Chris and his staff were courteous, friendly and treated us very well and effectively resolved a minor booking oversight as we had upgraded our suite after the initial booking and a food / drink voucher was no longer offered, however Chris allowed us to charge a meal to our room from one of the affiliated restaurants (we chose the Keg @ Banff Caribou Lodge-one of the best Keg's we've ever attended) and he credited the original amount offered under the deal.
reviews.title: Be aware of the 'one bedroom condo' which is a basement suite

reviews.text: My friends were upgraded upon arrival as thier original room was not ready . With 3 children (under 10 yrs old ) and 6 adults we were blessed with a 3 level /3 bedroom condo complete with a plasma screen TV in almost every room, a bubble hockey game and Wii Game System in the basement for the kids. There were also two pull out couches . The kitchen was an open concept and the view was of the friendly elk of Banff. The outdoor hot tubs were great ! one for the kids and one for the adults all within viewing distance .
reviews.title: exceeded my expectations and very accomodating for the kids

reviews.text: The BBQ area was also right outside the room - it was a perfect weekend !
reviews.title: Fantastic Weekend

reviews.text: We orginially stayed several years ago and loved it. We returned for Thanksgiving this year and it was even better. They made some great upgrades to the resort: underground parking, a nice new lobby, and some great outdoor hot pools.
reviews.title: Once you Stay at Hidden Ridge you wont want to go Anywhere Else!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I dont recall any staff coming by to do even a light cleaning, but I guess they only do that if youre there for more than three nights. We could not get the wireless net to work in our suite, but they provided me with a cable to use the net in the lobby. A little annoyance, but we were on vacation anyways. Had I been on a business trip I could not deal with that. If I were to return for business I would need some assurance that this is not an issue before booking.
reviews.title: I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had three couples and 1 baby - the suite was the perfect size for us.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort, will be back again soon!

description: Tucked away on Tunnel Mountain, Hidden Ridge Resort is quiet and secluded with some of the most spectacular views in Banff and the Canadian Rockies. The modern condos feature wood burning fireplaces, full kitchens and patios or balconies. Take a stroll along one of the many hiking trails around Tunnel Mountain that start outside your door. The tranquil and secluded setting makes it one of Banff's best-kept secrets. Only a mile from downtown area.
